body_html:
TensorBoard does store many images per tag, but as you point out the UI only surfaces the most recent one.

This could be improved by adding some UI for loading older images in the sequence - maybe a slider on the left that changes which image gets loaded by each image-loader, e.g. if the slider is set to the far left it loads the earliest image, if it is set to far right it loads the latest image.

I don't think the TensorBoard team will prioritize this right now, but we would gladly advise on a pull request if you (or anyone else) wants to add this feature.

Also, you can use the reload icon in the top-left rather than F5.

body:
TensorBoard does store many images per tag, but as you point out the UI only surfaces the most recent one.

This could be improved by adding some UI for loading older images in the sequence - maybe a slider on the left that changes which image gets loaded by each image-loader, e.g. if the slider is set to the far left it loads the earliest image, if it is set to far right it loads the latest image.

I don't think the TensorBoard team will prioritize this right now, but we would gladly advise on a pull request if you (or anyone else) wants to add this feature.

Also,  you can use the reload icon in the top-left rather than F5.
